text: The ALS Ice Bucket Challenge basically broke the internet when it launched in 2014, with everyone from celebrities to librarians filming themselves covered in ice water and nominating their friends by name to join them. While the choice was dump or donate, many did both and the ALS Association raised a historic $ 115 million for the devastating disease, per the website. From there, over $ 96 million has been committed to research projects. You can check the progress on those projects here. And now, four years later, there's a new challenge in town : the ALS Pepper Challenge. Lou Gehrig's disease, also known as ALS, is a fatal neurodegenerative disease that worsens and weakens muscles in those who have the disease.
